Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 27th overall pick, by Kansas City in 1966...
Injured on 4/13/1966 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 5/11/1966 with a Sore Knee, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 8/17/1968, off John Hiller (MIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/20/1971, off Bill Singer (BOS)...
Drove in 6 runs against Chicago (A) on 4/15/1975...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/18/1976, hitting .481 with 2 HR, 12 RBI...
Injured on 9/21/1980 with a Fractured Knee, out for 6 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against California on 5/11/1982...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 5/28/1983, off Renie Martin (CHW)...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against New York (A) on 8/30/1983...
